result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Atty Dodge indicates he just eFiled the information a few seconds ago. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Johnathon P. Matke in court, in custody from the Portage County jail.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Johnathon P. Matke. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:53 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Johnathon P. Matke appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Johnathon P. Matke. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present. 
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court questions the defendant regarding refusing to sign the bond. 
Defendant states he received revocation papers and signed those. 

Atty Weiland will go talk to the defendant after the hearing regarding possibly resolving today. 
Court will set the date for next week with the understanding it might be waived. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Atty William Weiland appointed
REFUSED TO SIGN SIGNATURE BOND

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Johnathon P. Matke appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail. 

Court questions the defendant regarding the status of his counsel. 
Defendant responds.  His fiance turned in the paperwork the public defender needed.  Asks to postpone the matter.  

Court will continue until next to check on the status.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Letter from the Defendant dated 06/21/22 in re:  request for appointment of an attorney
Initial Appearance set for June 27, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 2

No contact with T.M. or his residence 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.

1:03 PM Defendant Johnathon Patrick Matke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.   Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant (came in at the end of the hearing).

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Battery - Substantial/Aggravated, Intend Bodily Harm and Felony Intimidation of a Victim. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Defendant is not public defender eligible.

Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
